sentences.english: They were divided by mutual suspicion and jealousies.
sentences.chinese: 他們因爲相互猜疑嫉妒而不和。

sentences.english: But we will not succumb to division or suspicion.
sentences.chinese: 但我們從不屈服於分裂或猜疑。

sentences.english: Emma saw its artifice, and returned to her first surmises.
sentences.chinese: 愛瑪看穿了她的伎倆，又回到了原先的猜疑上。

sentences.english: I trust an indiscreet fool and suspect a lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 吾信任輕率之傻子而猜疑律師。

sentences.english: She was tormented by jealousy, just like suspicion of Procris towards her husband.
sentences.chinese: 她爲嫉妒所折磨，就像普洛克里斯猜疑她的丈夫一樣。

sentences.english: The heart such as bat suspected, it always takes off in the evening.
sentences.chinese: 猜疑之心猶如蝙蝠，它總是在黃昏中起飛。

sentences.english: In the absence of transparency, fear and suspicion have provoked violence.
sentences.chinese: 在沒有透明度的情況下，恐懼和猜疑引發了暴力事件。

sentences.english: And they were all amazed, and were in doubt, saying one to another, What meaneth this?
sentences.chinese: 衆人就都驚訝猜疑，彼此說，這是什麼意思呢。

sentences.english: Quite unaccountably, the Chinese fought among themselves for power and money, suspecting and hating each other.
sentences.chinese: 中國人就是那樣毫無原因地互相爭權奪利和猜疑仇恨。

sentences.english: People guessed, people knew, and eventually it was only a matter of time before it all had to come out.
sentences.chinese: 人們的猜疑，窺探，到最後事情最終被敗露。

sentences.english: A gentleman will never hurt a woman under any circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 一個真正有教養的人是沒有妒忌猜疑或報復心的。

sentences.english: If not, the world faces decades of hostility and mistrust.
sentences.chinese: 否則，世界將面臨數十年的敵意和猜疑。

sentences.english: Japan is also known for its paranoia of foreign diseases.
sentences.chinese: 日本衆所周知是一個猜疑外國疾病的偏執狂。

sentences.english: Suspicion has reached such a pitch that a decision will have to be made immediately.
sentences.chinese: 各種猜疑甚囂塵上，以至必須立即做出決定。

sentences.english: The solider didn't know he was under suspicion.
sentences.chinese: 士兵不知道他受到猜疑。

sentences.english: But the talks are occurring in an atmosphere of mutual suspicion, in which confrontational invective is growing.
sentences.chinese: 但談判在相互猜疑的氣氛中開始，對峙的惡言在增加。

definition: to be suspicious and jealous of
to hate out of jealousy/to resent
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
to worry about personal gains and losses
to doubt (sth)/to be skeptical of/to have one's doubts/to harbor suspicions/to suspect that
to be jealous of (sb's achievements etc)/to be envious/envy
